text:
Once the world’s largest landfill, Fresh Kills in Staten Island, New York, serves as a burial ground for 1.8 million tons of rubble from the 9/11 attacks.

A study by the city’s health department published earlier this year found somewhat elevated bladder and thyroid cancer rates around the landfill in recent years, but concluded there was little evidence of an association between living close to the former landfill and cancer.

CNN interviews public health officials, legal experts, community leaders, and cancer patients to explain why some members of New York’s “forgotten borough” are demanding further investigation. https://cnn.it/2RhbznJ

Stocks are set to open higher Friday, closing out a short and volatile week of trading on Wall Street. Consumer prices rose more than expected in August, news that might raise some inflation alarm bells. Supermarket chain Kroger also reported healthy earnings as consumers continue to hunker down at home and buy more food during the pandemic.

CNN Business was live.

text:
Stocks are attempting to rally for a second straight day Thursday -- despite another glum report from the government that showed 884,000 people filed for unemployment benefits last week. The Nasdaq is headed for a solid opening gain as investors continue to flock back to big tech stocks.

CNN Business was live.
September 10 at 9:30 AM ·

Stocks are attempting to rally for a second straight day Thursday -- despite another glum report from the government that showed 884,000 people filed for unemployment benefits last week. The Nasdaq is headed for a solid opening gain as investors continue to flock back to big tech stocks. In corporate news, luxury furnishings retailer RH is soaring after reporting strong earnings. And bankrupt JCPenney has a deal to remain in business after agreeing to sell itself to two of its landlords, mall owners Simon and Brookfield. Wall Street giant Citigroup also announced that Jane Fraser will be its new CEO, marking the first time a woman will be in charge at a top bank.

text:
Once the world’s largest landfill, Fresh Kills in Staten Island, New York, serves as a burial ground for 1.8 tons million tons of rubble from the 9/11 attacks.

A study by the city’s health department published earlier this year found somewhat elevated bladder and thyroid cancer rates around the landfill in recent years, but concluded there was little evidence of an association between living close to the former landfill and cancer.

CNN interviews public health officials, legal experts, community leaders, and cancer patients to explain why some members of New York’s “forgotten borough” are demanding further investigation.

Stocks are looking to rebound Wednesday, as Tesla and hard hit tech stocks lead the charge. Drug giant AstraZeneca is slipping a bit after disclosing that is pausing a trial for a Covid-19 vaccine. text:
Stocks are set to tumble again after a long holiday weekend. Big techs in the Nasdaq are likely to plunge due to concerns about the major bet that Japanese investing giant SoftBank has made on the sector. Apple is down more than 5%.

CNN Business was live.
September 8 at 9:30 AM ·

Stocks are set to tumble again after a long holiday weekend. Big techs in the Nasdaq are likely to plunge due to concerns about the major bet that Japanese investing giant SoftBank has made on the sector. Apple is down more than 5%. In other corporate news, Tesla is likely to plummet on a double dose of bad news. The company was not chosen to be added to the blue chip S&P 500 index, a move that many thought was likely. And Tesla rival Nikola is partnering with General Motors. GM is getting a stake in Nikola and will help build Nikola's electric Badger truck. Nikola shares are up nearly 30%.

Greenland's ice sheet has melted to a point of no return, and efforts to slow global warming will not stop it from disintegrating.

text: Stocks are looking to end a choppy week on a negative note, with futures pointing to a drop at the open for the Dow, S&P 500 and Nasdaq. The US government reported that personal income fell last month but that spending increased more than expected in May. Big banks will be in focus after a strong rally Thursday. Shares of Goldman Sachs, JPMorgan Chase and other top Wall Street firms are likely to fall after the Federal Reserve announced the results of its latest bank stress tests and said banks should cap their quarterly dividend payout to shareholders and suspend stock buybacks due to the Covid-19 outbreak and economic uncertainty.

text:
Go There heads to an undisclosed location in Georgia to visit Freedom University, the nation’s only sanctuary campus for undocumented students. The community has been on edge while anxiously awaiting the Supreme Court's decision on whether to terminate the DACA program. On Thursday, it was announced that DACA participants would be able to remain in the US -- for now. We follow several students as they gather at this underground network to talk about their uncertain futures.

Note: This episode was filmed in February before the coronavirus shutdown when classes at Freedom University were still in session.

text:
Futures are pointing to a higher open Monday following a gigantic rally Friday on the back of the much better than expected jobs report. Investors are also eagerly awaiting the Federal Reserve meeting on Wednesday, The central bank is expected to leave interest rates near zero in order to try and help stimulate the economy.

CNN Business was live.
June 8 at 9:30 AM ·

Futures are pointing to a higher open Monday following a gigantic rally Friday on the back of the much better than expected jobs report. Investors are also eagerly awaiting the Federal Reserve meeting on Wednesday, The central bank is expected to leave interest rates near zero in order to try and help stimulate the economy. In corporate news, shares of biotech Gilead Sciences, the maker of the remdesivir treatment that is being used with Covid-19 patients, are higher following a Bloomberg report saying that Big Pharma giant AstraZeneca has expressed interest in a merger with Gilead.

Euphoria about Joe Biden's big Super Tuesday wins is being replaced by renewed worries about the global coronavirus outbreak. Gold is surging again and bond yields are falling -- another sign that investors are flocking to safe-haven trades.

text: South Korea has more cases of the coronavirus than any other country in the world outside of mainland China. In response, the city of Goyang has developed free drive-through clinics to test for the virus, freeing up hospitals, protecting healthcare workers and speeding up the testing process. CNN’s Ivan Watson visits one of these sites, where he was met by doctors in protective gear – nasal swabs at the ready – to undergo the test.
